page.title: 13HOUSES IN BUCKNALL
page.content:
There are 82{houses}and utility buildings in Bucknall.
The only stone building is the{Church of St Margaret's. It is also the only building with rosemary tiles.
30 of the buildings were single storey, and 52 were 2 storey. There are no houses with more than 2 storeys.
Most of the houses have been built since 1950, but there are many from earlier this century and a few that are more than one hundred years old.
Unlike{Horsington,}there is no thatched cottage. Most roofs are concrete tiles (53), but 11 are slate, 15 are pantiled and 2 are felted.
